work.name: Indian Institute of Tropical Meteorology, Pune, India
work.summary: Developed spatiotemporal models to forecast environmental risk events (e.g., forest fires, stubble burning) using satellite data. Built ConvLSTM models achieving 0.8 temporal correlation for 1-day forecasting across geospatial grids. Designed and implemented automated data pipelines for scalable preprocessing and visualization. Enabled operational decision-making by translating real-world risk forecasting problems into ML solutions. Co-authored a peer-reviewed publication in Modeling Earth Systems and Environment.

publications.name: Zur Elektrody/namik bewegter Körper
publications.summary: It concerned an interpretation of the Michelson–Morley experiment and the properties of light and time. Special relativity incorporates the principle that the speed of light is the same for all inertial observers regardless of the state of motion of the source.

projects.name: Quantum Computing
projects.summary: Quantum computing is the use of quantum-mechanical phenomena such as superposition and entanglement to perform computation. Computers that perform quantum computations are known as quantum computers.
